title: Scafell Pike
summary: Scafell Pike (/ˈskɔːfɛl paɪk/)[2] is the highest and the most prominent mountain in England, at an elevation of 978 metres (3,209 ft) above sea level.[1][3] It is located in the Lake District National Park, in Cumbria, and is part of the Southern Fells and the Scafell massif.[4]
